cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone (not yet on SSHS scale)
cyclone.current_location: about 170 mi ESE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn west late Thursday, then west-northwest Friday and approach the central Louisiana coast Saturday before moving inland toward Arkansas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast (near Morgan City–Lafayette area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Morgan City, LA (Tropical-Storm and Storm-Surge Watches)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: coastline from the upper Texas coast eastward across Louisiana and Mississippi to the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible (34–50 kt probability up to 64%) beginning late Friday night or Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding possible, generally below 3 ft
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential 6–10 inches with isolated higher amounts, creating flooding risk around port facilities
weather_observation.other_hazards: High waves/seas on Sabine-Neches waterway, frequent thunderstorms and lightning, possible river/stream rises that could limit navigation
